Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
group33.VirtualPet.src.main.model.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
Represents an inventory system for a virtual pet game. Manages two types of items: Food (restores pet's fullness) and Gifts (boosts pet's happiness). Tracks quantities of each item and provides methods for adding/using items.
Since:
Winter 2025
Author:
Team 33 (Dhir, Kostya, Fatima, Anna)

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    Inventory.FoodItem
    Represents a food item that can be fed to pets to increase their fullness.
    static class 
    Inventory.GiftItem
    Represents a gift item that can be given to pets to increase their happiness.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      Creates a new Inventory with default items. Initializes with: - 4 Apples, 3 Smoothies, 2 Tacos, 1 Ramen (food) - 4 Balls, 3 Cards, 2 Flowers, 1 Hat (gifts)

  • Method Details

    • addFoodItem

      public void addFoodItem(Inventory.FoodItem item, int quantity)
      Adds food items to the inventory. If the item already exists, increases its quantity.
      Parameters:
      item - The food item to add
      quantity - How many of this item to add

    • addGiftItem

      public void addGiftItem(Inventory.GiftItem item, int quantity)
      Adds gift items to the inventory. If the item already exists, increases its quantity.
      Parameters:
      item - The gift item to add
      quantity - How many of this item to add

    • useFoodItem

      public boolean useFoodItem(Inventory.FoodItem item)
      Attempts to use one food item from inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The food item to use
      Returns:
      True if item was available and used, false otherwise

    • useGiftItem

      public boolean useGiftItem(Inventory.GiftItem item)
      Attempts to use one gift item from inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The gift item to use
      Returns:
      True if item was available and used, false otherwise

    • getFoodItems

      public Map<Inventory.FoodItem,Integer> getFoodItems()
      Gets a copy of all food items in inventory and their quantities.
      Returns:
      A new Map containing all food items and their counts

    • getGiftItems

      public Map<Inventory.GiftItem,Integer> getGiftItems()
      Gets a copy of all gift items in inventory and their quantities.
      Returns:
      A new Map containing all gift items and their counts
